meanings.definition: To reduce the amount of a debt by making payments.
meanings.sent1: I will paydown my student loan by making monthly payments.
meanings.sent2: She decided to paydown her credit card debt by paying more than the minimum amount.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel worked hard to paydown its nut debt before winter.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays seemed to paydown the darkness of the night sky.
meanings.sent5: With each step, he felt like he was paydown the distance between himself and his goal.

meanings.definition: The act of paying off a debt gradually.
meanings.sent1: A paydown of the mortgage can bring a sense of relief to homeowners.
meanings.sent2: The company's financial stability improved due to a consistent paydown of its loans.
meanings.sent3: The paydown of the chocolate cake was a slow and enjoyable process.
meanings.sent4: The paydown of the national debt requires careful planning and discipline.
meanings.sent5: The gradual paydown of the student loans allowed her to focus on other financial goals.
